register.description: IPE5 Mode Register.

bitfield.description: 1 => Encoder mode 0 => Decoder mode (IPE5 is shut down)
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
1 => H.241 0 => Normal mode
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Pre-Encode pass Mode enable. 0 : Full Encode Pass 1 : Pre-Encode Pass
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

register.description: IPE5 Codec type register.

bitfield.description: Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

register.description: IPE5 Basic Settings Register for IPE5-CORE.

bitfield.description: Mode of left block to current MB. 0 : Use mode from the MB-info of left MB, which is internally stored 1 : Used fixed mode2 (DC)
Mode of Top block to current MB. 0 : Use mode from the MB-info of top MB, which is provided by CALC 1 : Used fixed mode2 (DC)
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
ZIGZAG Mode of MB processing in frame. 0 : Use raster scan order. This is defualt. 1 : Use zig-zag scan order for MB processsing.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Enable SIP to search in 4X4 Partition type. 0 : 4X4 Partition type is NOT searched 0 : 4X4 Partition type is searched for best modes and partition type evaluation
Enable SIP to search in 8X8 Partition type. 0 : 8X8 Partition type is NOT searched 0 : 8X8 Partition type is searched for best modes and partition type evaluation
Enable SIP to search in 16X16 Partition type. 0 : 16X16 Partition type is NOT searched 0 : 16X16 Partition type is searched for best modes and partition type evaluation
Enable SIP to search Cr. 0 : Cr component is NOT searched 0 : Cr component is searched for best modes evaluation
Enable SIP to search Cb. 0 : Cb component is NOT searched 0 : Cb component is searched for best modes evaluation
Enable SATD based best mode selection. 0 : Only SAD based best mode selection, which is default 1 : SATD based best mode selection

Indicates the mb_type of left MB. This data is valid only in case of constrained intra prediction. 00 : Left mb_type is same as TOP LEFT Macroblock mb_type. 01 : Left mb_type is assumed intra 10 : Left mb_type is assumed inter 11 : Left mb_type is median of top, top_left and (top_left-1) mb_types
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
0 => 4X4 Mode3 is optimized for faster MB processing. 1 => 4x4 Mode3 optimization is disabled. Slower MB processing.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Support a flexible scaling factors for SATD value. 0 – no scaling 1 – right shift by 1 2 – right shift by 2 3 – right shift by 3

register.description: IPE5 Basic Settings Register for PREPROCESSOR.

bitfield.description: Enable computation of SUM of pixels in MB for Weighted Prediction statistics 0 : SUM computation NOT enabled 1 : SUM computation enabled
Enable computation of SUM of SQUARE of pixels in MB for Weighted Prediction statistics 0 : SUM of SQUARES computation NOT enabled 1 : SUM of SQUARES computation enabled

0 : Activity 4x4 NOT updated in activity-info. 1 : Activity 4x4 updated in activity-info. For funtions which need activity information like RC and HNS, the internal activity computation is enabled but value is not updated in activity-info if this bit is not set.

0 : Activity 8x8 NOT updated in activity-info. 1 : Activity 8x8 updated in activity-info. For funtions which need activity information like RC and HNS, the internal activity computation is enabled but value is not updated in activity-info if this bit is not set.

0 : Activity 16x16 NOT updated in activity-info. 1 : Activity 16x16 updated in activity-info. For funtions which need activity information like RC and HNS, the internal activity computation is enabled but value is not updated in activity-info if this bit is not set.

Enable PICAFF statistics accumulation step. This is valid only in pre-processing pass. 0: PicAFF support disabled. Input data is assumed to be progressive OR seperate fields. 1: PicAFF support enabled. Input data is assumed to be interlaced frame.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Indicates whether the input original pixels in SL2 is tiled or raster. 0 : Input is TILED. 1 : Input is RASTER.
Control bit to indicate that the input data is interlaced frame for pre-encode pass. 0 : Input is Progressive OR seperate Fields (top/bottom) 1 : Input is interlaced frame

register.description: IPE5 Control register for Horizontal Noise Suppresion.

bitfield.description: Control to enable the activity based HNS (Type 1, similar to IPE53) 0 : Activity based HNS is disabled. 1 : Activity based HNS is enabled.
Control to enable the Neighouring MB partition type based HNS (Type 3) 0 : Neighouring MB partition type based HNS is disabled. 1 : Neighouring MB partition type based HNS is enabled.

Control bit to enable HNS when left MB partition type is 8X8. 0 : Disable Partition type based HNS if left MB partition type is 8X8. 1 : Enable Partition type based HNS if left MB partition type is 8X8.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

Control bit to choose the algorithms of HNS (Activity and partition type based). 1 : Horizontal modes is suppressed if all the enabled algo’s indicate suppression. 0 : Horizontal modes is suppressed if either of the enabled algo indicates suppression.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Control to enable the activity based HNS (Type 2) 0 : Activity based HNS is disabled. 1 : Activity based HNS is enabled.
Control bit to enable suppression of MODE6 in case HNS indicates suppression. 0 : MODE6 Allowed even if HNS inidcates suppression. 1 : MODE6 Suppressed in case HNS indicates suppression.
Control bit to enable suppression of MODE8 in case HNS indicates suppression. 0 : MODE8 Allowed even if HNS inidcates suppression. 1 : MODE8 Suppressed in case HNS indicates suppression.
Control bit to choose the set of blocks on which horizontal modes are disabled. 0 : Disable horizontal modes for all blocks. 1 : Disable horizontal modes for left blocks only.

register.description: IPE5 Rate Control register.

bitfield.description: Enable bit for IPE5 rate control. 0 : Rate control is disabled. 1 : Rate control is enabled.
Activity select option. 00 : Choose 16X16 activity. 01 : Choose 8X8 activity. 10 : Choose 4X4 activity. 11 : Reserved. If set, by default will use 4X4 activity.
Edge Detection result to be used for Rate control. 0: Text Detection result is not used. 1: Text detection result will modify Qscale for Rate Control.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Base ROW level Qscale value. Expressed in Q4 format. To be programmed by ICONT at row level.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
ForceSkip information to be updated by ICONT at row level along with BRQScale. This information is passed onto IME and consumed by IPE5.

register.description: The register has information on N MB's to pick per VDMA access. Register also has details on horizontal and vertical skip in the sub-picture. Used only for pre-encode pass.

Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

register.description: VDMA Trigger Interface control MMR.

bitfield.description: Number of MB's to fetch for original pixels for non end of row. N can be end of row fetch also, in case width is a multiple of N. Supported values of N are 1 to 16. 0000 : N = 1 0001 : N = 2 0010 : N = 3 0011 : N = 4 ... 1111 : N = 16

Value of number of MB fetch at the row end. This value is always less and N. The supported values are 0 to 15. 0000 : 0 (Default, indicates M is not used) 0001 : M=1 0010 : M=2 0011 : M=3 0100 : M=4 ... 1111 : M=15
Group1 ID. This is a 6-bit value. Only group 1 is valid for pre-encode pass.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Group2 ID. Only valid in full-encode pass and used for last row of frame when MB padding is needed. If MB-padding is not needed this group is not needed.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Group3 ID. Only valid in full-encode pass interlaced input and used for last row of frame when MB padding is needed. If MB-padding is not needed this group is not needed.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

bitfield.description: Software reset Read0: Reset done, no pending action Read1: Reset (software or other) on going Write0: No action Write1: Initiate software reset

register.description:
RAW interrupt status for IPE5. Raw status is set even if event is not enabled. Write 1 to set the (raw) status, mostly for debug.
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event (for debug) Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: DRM End of N MacroBlock fetch Status.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
DRM Data Sync Status.
PRE End of MB Status
PRE End of Row Status
PRE End of Slice Status
PRE End of Frame Status
CORE End of MB Status
CORE End of Row Status
CORE End of Slice Status
CORE End of Frame Status
PRE End of N MB status

register.description:
Status of enabled sources for interrupt IPE5. The individual status bits are not set, unless the source is enabled (by setting corresponding bit in IRQ_ENABLE_SET register) Write "1" to specific bit in this register to clear the status after interrupt has been serviced. Note : Writing "1" clears the "raw" status as well Note : Writing "1" generates internal EOI. The interrupt line is pulsed again, if any of the interrupt sources are still active (any of the status bits are "1") after the write of "1".
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Clear (raw) event - clears the corresponding bit in this register as well as the "raw" status bit in the IRQ_STATUS_RAW register Read 0: No enabled event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: DRM End of N MacroBlock fetch Status.

register.description:
Interrupt enable for each of the sources for interrupt IPE5. Writing "1" to specific field in this register enables the corresponding source for interrupt generatation The read value reflects whether the corresponding source is enabled/disabled for interrupt generation
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Enable interrupt Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked) Read 1: Interrupt enabled

Interrupt disable for each of the sources for interrupt IPE5. Writing "1" to specific field in this register disables the corresponding source for interrupt generatation The read value reflects whether the corresponding source is enabled/disabled for interrupt generation
The following is the behavior for read/write into each of the individual fields : Write 0: No action Write 1: Disable interrupt Read 0: Interrupt disabled (masked) Read 1: Interrupt enabled

register.description:
Interrupt blocking configuration for interrupt IPE5.
If a bit in this register is set to "1", the IPE5-DRM thread halts after it generates an interrupt for the corresponding interrupt source, and waits for interrupt acknowledgement for that interrupt line before continuing execution.
If a bit in this register is set to "0", the IPE5-DRM does not halt after it generates an interrupt for the corresponding interrupt source
The configuration in this register only apply to enabled interrupt sources.

bitfield.description: DRM End of N MacroBlock Interrupt blocking configuration.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

register.description: BC_ENABLE Bits for specific BC's instantiated in IPE5. If this register is 0, the corresponding BC's ready is not looked for thread to proceed its execution.

bitfield.description: BC_ENABLE bit for CONSM_SPARE_0 SL2BC. If set to '0', then BC availability is not checked for MB execution.

Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
BC_ENABLE bit for ACTIVITYNIFO SL2BC. If set to '0', then activity info BC availability is not checked for MB execution and activity-info is not written into SL2.

register.description: BC_CLEAR Bits for all the BC's instantiated in IPE5. The bits set to '1' are auto-cleared in 1 cycle. So, the read will always yield '0'.

BC_CLEAR bit for LBC_ORG_BUF LBC.
BC_CLEAR bit for SL2BC_ORG_RASTER_TILED_YUV SL2BC.

register.description: Indicates that the start of a new frame to the IPE5. Self clearing bit. This will be used for all use cases. Write[0] : No impact Write[1] : Indicates start of frame for IPE5. Read[0] : Operation is not on SOF Read[1] : Operation is on SOF.

bitfield.description: 1=> Indicates start of frame to IPE5. This has to be set by ICONT. 0=> Indicates that current operation is not on start of frame.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

register.description: SL2 base address for fetching MMR programmation data for BUFFER_BA_MMR, BUFFER_CONTROL_MMR and FUNC_MMR. IPE5 will fetch 1024 bytes (64 SL2 access) to update these MMR regions.

bitfield.description: SL2 Address for reference pixels.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
1 => Program auto load enabled. 0 => No autoload is required. MMR programmed by ICONT.

register.description: Indicates the MB location from where IPE5 must start. This is needed for channel switching use case and H.241 rewind use case.

bitfield.description: MB x location.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
MB y location.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
Self clearing bit after init. 1=> Use (MBx, MBy) in this register to start in case of rewind and continue OR channel switch use case. 0=> MBx, MBy is ignored. Normal encode flow.

register.description: Indicates the MB location where IPE5 must pipedown. This is needed for channel switching use case.

bitfield.description: MB x location.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
MB y location.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
1=> Use (MBx, MBy) in this register to insert end of pipe and end of slice for current channel. 0=> MBx, MBy is ignored. Normal encode flow.

register.description: Slice size control register. Indicates number of MB's per slice.

bitfield.description: Number of MB's per slice. Once IPE5 has processed these many number of MB's, the end_of_slice flag in MB-info will be asserted. This value is valid only when EOS_ENABLE is set to '1'.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
End of slice enable. For H.241 use case, this bit has to be set to '0'. EOS is not inserted by IPE in this case.

register.description: N MB interrupt control register for IPE5-PRE.

bitfield.description: Number of MBs, after which interrupt needs to be generated. ( if 1, interrupt generated every MB ); MAX_COUNT of 0 is illegal; EN bit should be 0 if MAX_COUNT = 0.
reserved space. read 0.
To enable or disable the counter to generate interrupt after N MB.

register.description: N MB interrupt count register for IPE5-PRE.

bitfield.description: If MB_COUNT_CTRL_PRE.ENABLE == 1, incremented first, and then compared against MB_COUNT_CTRL_PRE.MAX_COUNT for each MB executed. If compare matches ( && MB_COUNT_CTRL_PRE.ENABLE == 1 ), interrupt is signaled to HTS; HTS generates interrupt provided interrupt source enabled after Tend. MB_COUNTER_PRE is reset to 0.
Reserved bits.

register.description: K*N MB interrupt control register for IPE5-DRM. This register provides the DATASYNC Support.

bitfield.description: Number of K (MAX_COUNT), N MBs, after which interrupt needs to be generated. ( if 1, interrupt generated every N MB ); MAX_COUNT of 0 is illegal; EN bit should be 0 if MAX_COUNT = 0.
reserved space. read 0.
To enable or disable the counter to generate interrupt after K*N MB.

register.description: K*N MB interrupt count register for IPE5-DRM.

bitfield.description: If MB_COUNT_CTRL_DRM.ENABLE == 1, incremented first, and then compared against MB_COUNT_CTRL_DRM.MAX_COUNT for each N MB executed/fetched. If compare matches ( && MB_COUNT_CTRL_DRM.ENABLE == 1 ), interrupt is signaled to HTS; HTS generates interrupt provided interrupt source enabled after Tend. MB_COUNTER_DRM is reset to 0.
Reserved bits.

register.description: Processing HALT control register.

bitfield.description: HALT enable bit. 0: IPE5 is normal processing. No half support. 1: IPE5 is in debug mode. Halt can be at end of MB, end of ROW, end of slice OR given MB position.
Halt after processing every MB. 0: Disabled. 1: Enabled.
Halt after processing every ROW. 0: Disabled. 1: Enabled.
Halt after processing every SLICE. 0: Disabled. 1: Enabled.
Halt after processing MB defined by MBX and MBY position. 0: Disabled. 1: Enabled.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
X co-ordinate of MB position at which IPE5 processing should halt.
Y co-ordinate of MB position at which IPE5 processing should halt.
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.

register.description: Read_only status register.

bitfield.description: Write pointer.
Indicates the BC status on the write side “00” wr_core_busy=0 & wr_bc_ready=0 “01” wr_core_busy=0 & wr_bc_ready=1 “1x” wr_core_busy=1
Reserved. '0' will be returned at Read, and Write will be ignored.
